types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Boolean_comparison_exp
types.description: Boolean expression to compare columns of type "Boolean". All fields are combined with logical 'AND'.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Int_comparison_exp
types.description: Boolean expression to compare columns of type "Int". All fields are combined with logical 'AND'.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: String_array_comparison_exp
types.description: Boolean expression to compare columns of type "String". All fields are combined with logical 'AND'.

inputFields.name: _contained_in
inputFields.description: is the array contained in the given array value

inputFields.name: _contains
inputFields.description: does the array contain the given value

types.name: String_comparison_exp
types.description: Boolean expression to compare columns of type "String". All fields are combined with logical 'AND'.

inputFields.name: _ilike
inputFields.description: does the column match the given case-insensitive pattern

inputFields.name: _iregex
inputFields.description: does the column match the given POSIX regular expression, case insensitive

inputFields.name: _like
inputFields.description: does the column match the given pattern

inputFields.name: _nilike
inputFields.description: does the column NOT match the given case-insensitive pattern

inputFields.name: _niregex
inputFields.description: does the column NOT match the given POSIX regular expression, case insensitive

inputFields.name: _nlike
inputFields.description: does the column NOT match the given pattern

inputFields.name: _nregex
inputFields.description: does the column NOT match the given POSIX regular expression, case sensitive

inputFields.name: _nsimilar
inputFields.description: does the column NOT match the given SQL regular expression

inputFields.name: _regex
inputFields.description: does the column match the given POSIX regular expression, case sensitive

inputFields.name: _similar
inputFields.description: does the column match the given SQL regular expression

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: bigint_comparison_exp
types.description: Boolean expression to compare columns of type "bigint". All fields are combined with logical 'AND'.

types.name: contacts
types.description: Normalized contact data for testimonial submitters. Enables contact management, deduplication across forms, and tracking of repeat submissions within an organization.

fields.name: avatar_url
fields.description: URL to profile photo or avatar image. Displayed alongside testimonials for visual social proof and authenticity.

fields.name: company_name
fields.description: Name of the company or organization where the contact works. Used for B2B testimonial displays and logo integration.

fields.name: company_website
fields.description: URL to the contact's company website. May be used for automated logo fetching or company verification.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when this contact record was first created. Set automatically on insert, never modified thereafter.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Primary identifier for the contact. Unique within each organization. Used for deduplication when same person submits multiple testimonials across different forms.

fields.name: email_verified
fields.description: Boolean flag indicating if email ownership has been confirmed via verification link. Verified contacts may receive preferential display treatment.

fields.name: first_seen_at
fields.description: Timestamp of first interaction with the organization. Set on creation and never modified. Used for cohort analysis and engagement metrics.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

fields.name: job_title
fields.description: Professional title or role (e.g., "VP of Engineering", "Founder"). Adds credibility context to testimonials, especially for B2B use cases.

fields.name: last_seen_at
fields.description: Timestamp of most recent activity. Updated on each new submission or interaction. Used for identifying active vs dormant contacts.

fields.name: linkedin_url
fields.description: URL to LinkedIn profile. Provides professional verification and enables social proof through platform recognition.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Display name of the contact. Collected from form submission contact_info step or enriched from external data sources like LinkedIn.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: Foreign key to organizations table. Establishes tenant boundary - all contacts are scoped to a single organization for multi-tenancy isolation.

fields.name: source
fields.description: Origin of this contact record: form_submission (created during testimonial submission), import (bulk CSV/API import), manual (admin created). Used for analytics and attribution.

fields.name: source_form
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: source_form_id
fields.description: Foreign key to forms table. References the first form through which this contact was acquired. Preserved even if form is later deleted (set null).

fields.name: submission_count
fields.description: Running count of testimonials submitted by this contact. Incremented on each new submission. Identifies power users and repeat customers.

fields.name: submissions
fields.description: An array relationship

args.name: distinct_on
args.description: distinct select on columns

args.name: limit
args.description: limit the number of rows returned

args.name: offset
args.description: skip the first n rows. Use only with order_by

args.name: order_by
args.description: sort the rows by one or more columns

args.description: filter the rows returned

inputFields.name: avatar_url
inputFields.description: URL to profile photo or avatar image. Displayed alongside testimonials for visual social proof and authenticity.

inputFields.name: company_name
inputFields.description: Name of the company or organization where the contact works. Used for B2B testimonial displays and logo integration.

inputFields.name: company_website
inputFields.description: URL to the contact's company website. May be used for automated logo fetching or company verification.

inputFields.name: created_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp when this contact record was first created. Set automatically on insert, never modified thereafter.

inputFields.name: email
inputFields.description: Primary identifier for the contact. Unique within each organization. Used for deduplication when same person submits multiple testimonials across different forms.

inputFields.name: email_verified
inputFields.description: Boolean flag indicating if email ownership has been confirmed via verification link. Verified contacts may receive preferential display treatment.

inputFields.name: first_seen_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp of first interaction with the organization. Set on creation and never modified. Used for cohort analysis and engagement metrics.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

inputFields.name: job_title
inputFields.description: Professional title or role (e.g., "VP of Engineering", "Founder"). Adds credibility context to testimonials, especially for B2B use cases.

inputFields.name: last_seen_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp of most recent activity. Updated on each new submission or interaction. Used for identifying active vs dormant contacts.

inputFields.name: linkedin_url
inputFields.description: URL to LinkedIn profile. Provides professional verification and enables social proof through platform recognition.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Display name of the contact. Collected from form submission contact_info step or enriched from external data sources like LinkedIn.

inputFields.name: organization_id
inputFields.description: Foreign key to organizations table. Establishes tenant boundary - all contacts are scoped to a single organization for multi-tenancy isolation.

inputFields.name: source
inputFields.description: Origin of this contact record: form_submission (created during testimonial submission), import (bulk CSV/API import), manual (admin created). Used for analytics and attribution.

inputFields.description: Foreign key to forms table. References the first form through which this contact was acquired. Preserved even if form is later deleted (set null).

types.name: flows
types.description: Defines branching paths for forms. Each form has flows (shared, testimonial, improvement) that determine step visibility based on user responses like rating. See ADR-009 for architecture details.

fields.name: branch_field
fields.description: Response column to evaluate. Valid values: answer_integer, answer_text, answer_boolean, answer_json. NULL for shared flows.

fields.name: branch_operator
fields.description: Comparison operator. Valid values: equals, not_equals, greater_than, greater_than_or_equal_to, less_than, less_than_or_equal_to, between, is_one_of, contains, is_empty. NULL for shared flows.

fields.name: branch_question
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: branch_question_id
fields.description: FK to form_questions (ON DELETE RESTRICT). The question whose answer determines this branch. NULL for shared flows.

fields.name: branch_value
fields.description: Structured comparison value as JSONB. Format: {type: "number"|"string"|"boolean"|"range"|"list", value: ...}. NULL for shared flows or is_empty operator.

args.name: path
args.description: JSON select path

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when this flow was first created. Set automatically, never modified.

fields.name: display_order
fields.description: Order for displaying flows in UI and queries. Convention: shared=0, branches follow (1, 2, ...).

fields.name: flow_type
fields.description: Flow behavior type: shared (always shown, before branch) or branch (conditional, after branch point).

fields.name: form
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: form_id
fields.description: Foreign key to forms table. Identifies which form this flow belongs to. Cascade deletes when parent form is removed.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

fields.name: is_primary
fields.description: Boolean flag marking the primary flow. Each form has exactly one primary flow (enforced by partial unique index). Primary flows are always shown; branch flows are conditional.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Human-readable flow name displayed in form editor (e.g., "Shared Steps", "Testimonial Flow", "Improvement Flow").

fields.name: organization
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: Foreign key to organizations for row-level security. Denormalized from form for efficient permission queries.

fields.description: An array relationship

inputFields.description: Comparison operator. Valid values: equals, not_equals, greater_than, greater_than_or_equal_to, less_than, less_than_or_equal_to, between, is_one_of, contains, is_empty. NULL for shared flows.

inputFields.name: branch_question_id
inputFields.description: FK to form_questions (ON DELETE RESTRICT). The question whose answer determines this branch. NULL for shared flows.

inputFields.name: branch_value
inputFields.description: Structured comparison value as JSONB. Format: {type: "number"|"string"|"boolean"|"range"|"list", value: ...}. NULL for shared flows or is_empty operator.

inputFields.name: created_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp when this flow was first created. Set automatically, never modified.

inputFields.name: display_order
inputFields.description: Order for displaying flows in UI and queries. Convention: shared=0, branches follow (1, 2, ...).

inputFields.name: flow_type
inputFields.description: Flow behavior type: shared (always shown, before branch) or branch (conditional, after branch point).

inputFields.name: form_id
inputFields.description: Foreign key to forms table. Identifies which form this flow belongs to. Cascade deletes when parent form is removed.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

inputFields.name: is_primary
inputFields.description: Boolean flag marking the primary flow. Each form has exactly one primary flow (enforced by partial unique index). Primary flows are always shown; branch flows are conditional.

inputFields.name: name
inputFields.description: Human-readable flow name displayed in form editor (e.g., "Shared Steps", "Testimonial Flow", "Improvement Flow").

inputFields.name: organization_id
inputFields.description: Foreign key to organizations for row-level security. Denormalized from form for efficient permission queries.

inputFields.name: updated_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp of last modification. Automatically updated by database trigger on any column change.

inputFields.name: max_file_size_kb
inputFields.description: Maximum file size in kilobytes for uploads. Post-MVP

inputFields.name: max_length
inputFields.description: Maximum character count for text answers. NULL = no maximum. Only for text types

inputFields.name: max_value
inputFields.description: Maximum numeric value for rating answers. Used with rating types (e.g., 5 for stars, 10 for NPS)

inputFields.name: min_length
inputFields.description: Minimum character count for text answers. NULL = no minimum. Only for text types

inputFields.name: min_value
inputFields.description: Minimum numeric value for rating answers. Used with rating types (e.g., 1 for stars)

inputFields.name: organization_id
inputFields.description: FK to organizations - tenant boundary for Hasura row-level permissions

inputFields.name: placeholder
inputFields.description: Input placeholder hint (e.g., "Describe your challenge...")

inputFields.name: question_key
inputFields.description: Semantic identifier unique per form (problem, solution, result, name, email). Used for answer lookup

inputFields.name: question_text
inputFields.description: Display text shown to customer (e.g., "What problem were you trying to solve?")

inputFields.name: question_type_id
inputFields.description: FK to question_types - determines input component and applicable validation rules

inputFields.name: scale_max_label
inputFields.description: Custom label for maximum value on Linear Scale (e.g., "High", "Strongly agree"). NULL uses default "High"

inputFields.name: scale_min_label
inputFields.description: Custom label for minimum value on Linear Scale (e.g., "Low", "Strongly disagree"). NULL uses default "Low"

inputFields.name: step_id
inputFields.description: FK to form_steps. The step that owns this question. Nullable for steps without questions (welcome, thank_you, consent). CASCADE delete removes question when step is deleted.

inputFields.name: updated_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp of last modification. Auto-updated by trigger

inputFields.name: updated_by
inputFields.description: FK to users - who last modified. NULL until first update

inputFields.name: validation_pattern
inputFields.description: Regex pattern for text validation. Used for email, URL, or custom format validation

types.name: form_steps
types.description: Form steps belong to flows. Question deletion handled by FK cascade on form_questions.step_id.

fields.name: content
fields.description: JSONB payload with type-specific configuration. Structure varies by step_type. Empty for question/rating types which use form_questions table instead.

args.name: path
args.description: JSON select path

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when this step record was first created. Set automatically, never modified.

fields.name: created_by
fields.description: Foreign key to users table. Records which user originally created this step for audit purposes.

fields.name: creator
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: flow
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: flow_id
fields.description: Foreign key to flows table. Links step to its parent flow (shared, testimonial, or improvement). Will be NOT NULL after backfill migration.

fields.name: flow_membership
fields.description: DEPRECATED: Legacy flow membership column. Use flow_id instead. This column will be removed in a future migration. Values are no longer constrained - any string is allowed during transition.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

fields.name: is_active
fields.description: Soft delete flag. False hides step from form while preserving data for historical analysis and potential restoration.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: Foreign key to organizations table. Denormalized from form for efficient row-level security queries. Must match form.organization_id.

fields.description: An array relationship

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Primary key using NanoID 12-character format for URL-safe, collision-resistant unique identification.

inputFields.name: is_active
inputFields.description: Soft delete flag. False hides step from form while preserving data for historical analysis and potential restoration.

inputFields.name: organization_id
inputFields.description: Foreign key to organizations table. Denormalized from form for efficient row-level security queries. Must match form.organization_id.

inputFields.name: step_order

inputFields.name: step_type

inputFields.name: tips
inputFields.description: Array of helper text strings shown to customers during question/rating steps. Provides guidance for better quality responses.

inputFields.name: updated_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp of last modification. Automatically updated by database trigger on any column change.

inputFields.name: updated_by

types.name: media
types.description:
Centralized tracking for all uploaded media files.

   This table stores metadata for files uploaded to cloud storage (S3, GCS, etc.)
   and tracks their processing status through the upload workflow.

   Key features:
   1. Provider-agnostic: storage_path is portable across providers
   2. Polymorphic: entity_type + entity_id links to any entity type
   3. Status workflow: tracks upload from pending to ready/failed
   4. Audit trail: tracks who uploaded and when

   Upload flow:
   1. API creates media record with status=pending
   2. Frontend uploads to presigned URL
   3. Lambda validates and calls webhook
   4. Webhook updates status to ready/failed

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when the media record was created (upload initiated).

fields.name: duration_seconds
fields.description:
Duration of video in seconds. Reserved for future video support.
   NULL for images.

fields.name: entity_id
fields.description:
ID of the entity this media is associated with.
   Nullable for pending uploads (entity may not exist yet).
   The target table is defined in media_entity_types.target_table.

fields.name: entity_type
fields.description:
Type of entity this media is associated with.
   References media_entity_types.code (not id).
   Examples: organization_logo, contact_avatar, testimonial_video.

fields.name: entity_type_config
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: error_message
fields.description:
Error details when status is failed.
   Examples: "File size exceeds limit", "Invalid MIME type", etc.

fields.name: file_size_bytes
fields.description:
File size in bytes. Used for quota tracking and validation against
   media_entity_types.max_file_size_bytes.

fields.name: filename
fields.description:
Original filename from the upload. Preserved for display purposes.
   The actual storage path uses a sanitized, unique name.

fields.name: height
fields.description:
Height of image/video in pixels. Populated by Lambda after processing.
   NULL for non-image files.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Opaque unique identifier (NanoID 12-char). This ID is embedded in the S3 path
   to correlate presigned URL with webhook callback.

fields.name: mime_type
fields.description:
MIME type of the file (e.g., image/png, video/mp4).
   Validated against media_entity_types.allowed_mime_types.

fields.name: organization
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description:
Organization that owns this media. Used for RLS, quota tracking, and data export.
   All media queries should filter by organization_id.

fields.name: processing_metadata
fields.description:
JSONB for provider-specific metadata.
   Examples: ImageKit file_id, CloudFront invalidation_id, virus scan results.
   This is appropriate use of JSONB: truly dynamic, provider-specific data.

args.name: path
args.description: JSON select path

fields.name: status
fields.description:
Processing status of the media file.
   - pending: Upload initiated, waiting for file
   - processing: File received, being validated
   - ready: Validation passed, file is available
   - failed: Validation failed, see error_message
   - deleted: Soft deleted, file may be retained for backup

fields.name: storage_bucket
fields.description:
Bucket/container name where the file is stored.
   Environment-specific: testimonials-dev-uploads, testimonials-prod-uploads, etc.

fields.name: storage_path
storage_provider
fields.description:
Storage provider identifier. Default is aws_s3.
   Other possible values: gcs (Google Cloud), azure_blob, etc.
   Used by CDN adapter to construct URLs.

fields.name: storage_region
fields.description:
AWS region or equivalent for other providers.
   Used for constructing direct S3 URLs if needed.

fields.name: thumbnail_path
fields.description:
Storage path for video thumbnail. Reserved for future video support.
   Lambda generates thumbnail and stores path here.

fields.name: updated_at
fields.description:
Timestamp of last modification. Auto-updated by trigger.
   Changes when status updates, processing completes, etc.

fields.name: uploaded_by
fields.description:
User who initiated the upload. NULL for anonymous uploads
   (e.g., form submissions by external customers).
   References users.id.

fields.name: uploader
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: width
fields.description:
Width of image/video in pixels. Populated by Lambda after processing.
   NULL for non-image files.

types.name: media_entity_types
types.description:
Lookup table defining valid media entity types with validation rules.

   This table serves multiple purposes:
   1. Enforces valid values for media.entity_type via FK constraint on `code`
   2. Stores validation rules (mime types, max size) queryable at runtime
   3. Documents the polymorphic relationship (which table entity_id references)
   4. Allows enabling/disabling entity types without code changes

   When adding a new entity type:
   1. INSERT a new row with appropriate validation rules
   2. Update Lambda validator if needed (for content-based validation)
   3. Update frontend upload config to match

fields.name: allowed_mime_types
fields.description:
PostgreSQL array of MIME types allowed for uploads of this entity type.
   Validated at two points:
   1. API presign endpoint (fast rejection)
   2. Lambda after upload (content-based verification)
   Example: ARRAY['image/jpeg', 'image/png', 'image/webp']

fields.name: code
fields.description:
Semantic code for the entity type. Use lowercase_snake_case.
   Examples: organization_logo, contact_avatar, testimonial_video.
   This value is stored in media.entity_type (FK target).
   UNIQUE constraint allows foreign key references.

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when this entity type was created. For audit purposes.

fields.name: created_by
fields.description:
User who created this entity type. NULL for seed data inserted by migrations.
   References users.id.

fields.name: description
fields.description:
Detailed description of what this media type is used for.
   Helps developers understand the purpose and context.

fields.name: display_name
fields.description: Human-readable name shown in UI. Example: "Organization Logo"

fields.name: id
fields.description:
Opaque unique identifier (NanoID 12-char). Following project convention
   that IDs should be meaningless. Use `code` for semantic lookups.

fields.name: is_active
fields.description:
Whether this entity type is currently enabled for uploads.
   Set to false to disable without deleting (preserves existing references).
   Use for feature flags or deprecating entity types.

fields.name: max_file_size_bytes
fields.description:
Maximum allowed file size in bytes. Enforced at:
   1. API presign endpoint (rejects before upload)
   2. Lambda validation (rejects after upload, deletes file)
   Common values: 2MB=2097152, 5MB=5242880, 10MB=10485760, 500MB=524288000

inputFields.name: created_at
inputFields.description: Timestamp when the media record was created (upload initiated).

inputFields.name: duration_seconds
inputFields.description:
Duration of video in seconds. Reserved for future video support.
   NULL for images.

inputFields.name: entity_id
inputFields.description:
ID of the entity this media is associated with.
   Nullable for pending uploads (entity may not exist yet).
   The target table is defined in media_entity_types.target_table.

inputFields.name: entity_type
inputFields.description:
Type of entity this media is associated with.
   References media_entity_types.code (not id).
   Examples: organization_logo, contact_avatar, testimonial_video.

inputFields.name: error_message
inputFields.description:
Error details when status is failed.
   Examples: "File size exceeds limit", "Invalid MIME type", etc.

inputFields.name: file_size_bytes
inputFields.description:
File size in bytes. Used for quota tracking and validation against
   media_entity_types.max_file_size_bytes.

inputFields.name: filename
inputFields.description:
Original filename from the upload. Preserved for display purposes.
   The actual storage path uses a sanitized, unique name.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description:
Height of image/video in pixels. Populated by Lambda after processing.
   NULL for non-image files.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description:
Opaque unique identifier (NanoID 12-char). This ID is embedded in the S3 path
   to correlate presigned URL with webhook callback.

inputFields.name: mime_type
inputFields.description:
MIME type of the file (e.g., image/png, video/mp4).
   Validated against media_entity_types.allowed_mime_types.

inputFields.name: organization_id
inputFields.description:
Organization that owns this media. Used for RLS, quota tracking, and data export.
   All media queries should filter by organization_id.

inputFields.name: processing_metadata
inputFields.description:
JSONB for provider-specific metadata.
   Examples: ImageKit file_id, CloudFront invalidation_id, virus scan results.
   This is appropriate use of JSONB: truly dynamic, provider-specific data.

inputFields.name: status
inputFields.description:
Processing status of the media file.
   - pending: Upload initiated, waiting for file
   - processing: File received, being validated
   - ready: Validation passed, file is available
   - failed: Validation failed, see error_message
   - deleted: Soft deleted, file may be retained for backup

inputFields.name: storage_bucket
inputFields.description:
Bucket/container name where the file is stored.
   Environment-specific: testimonials-dev-uploads, testimonials-prod-uploads, etc.

inputFields.name: storage_path
storage_provider
inputFields.description:
Storage provider identifier. Default is aws_s3.
   Other possible values: gcs (Google Cloud), azure_blob, etc.
   Used by CDN adapter to construct URLs.

inputFields.name: storage_region
inputFields.description:
AWS region or equivalent for other providers.
   Used for constructing direct S3 URLs if needed.

inputFields.name: thumbnail_path
inputFields.description:
Storage path for video thumbnail. Reserved for future video support.
   Lambda generates thumbnail and stores path here.

inputFields.name: updated_at
inputFields.description:
Timestamp of last modification. Auto-updated by trigger.
   Changes when status updates, processing completes, etc.

inputFields.name: uploaded_by
inputFields.description:
User who initiated the upload. NULL for anonymous uploads
   (e.g., form submissions by external customers).
   References users.id.

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description:
Width of image/video in pixels. Populated by Lambda after processing.
   NULL for non-image files.

types.name: question_options
types.description: Predefined choices for choice-type questions (radio, checkbox, dropdown)

fields.name: created_at
fields.description: Timestamp when option was created. Immutable after insert

fields.name: created_by
fields.description: FK to users - user who created this option

fields.name: creator
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: display_order
fields.description: Order in option list. Unique per question, starts at 1

fields.name: id
fields.description: Primary key - NanoID 12-char unique identifier

fields.name: is_active
fields.description: Soft delete flag. False = option hidden but existing answers preserved

fields.name: is_default
fields.description: Pre-selected when form loads. Only one per question should be true

fields.name: option_label
fields.description: Display text shown to customer (e.g., "Yes, definitely!", "Not right now")

fields.name: option_value
fields.description: Stored value saved in form_question_responses (e.g., "yes", "no", "maybe")

fields.name: organization
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: organization_id
fields.description: FK to organizations - tenant boundary for Hasura row-level permissions

fields.name: question
fields.description: An object relationship

fields.name: question_id
fields.description: FK to form_questions - must be a choice-type question
